text: Hi I am having a problem with updating the batch of contacts using POST /crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/update
I want to know about the payload format

Hey everyone! I want to retrieve the Salesforce ID from a property using an API. Is there a way to obtain the Salesforce ID? Additionally, based on the Salesforce ID, I want to import a file from local storage to HubSpot using an API. I have already imported a file from local storage to a contact using the Engagement API based on the HubSpot ID. Can we use the Engagement API to import a file based on the Salesforce ID?

Thanks
Hello, does anyone know how to recover the discounted price of a line_item and not the original price of it? I don't know which property to include in my url parameters. Thanks a lot
anyone can help me ?

I am trying to send a timeline event through postman and I am getting this error:
I configured timeline template on my developer account and I don't see a way to configure a timeline template on other hs normal account
you have to install the app in the portal
if you built a public app in your developer portal, then you have to go install it into the portal you want to use it in
I do have it installed
it is the one that says reachsuite
Just make it work!
your error message looks like you set up the event template different than what you are sending with the new event

hi team!
does anybody know how to work around the lack of "last modified by" property on contacts and companies? For synchronization concerns I need to distinguish modifications made by a specific user than the rest.
Can someone help me with this?
thanks a lot for your ideas :slightly_smiling_face:
Contacts API v3 Batch Update using email as Unique Id
the issue was that the tokens were not defined on my event. It was weird because I created them with Postman, but when checking the UI found that

there is also a course you might consider on HubSpot Academy covering the APIs and it has a section on authentication.  Integrating With HubSpot I: Foundations <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/integrating-with-HubSpot-foundations>
ohh okay

have you explored <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts#:~:text=in%20the%20response.-,propertiesWithHistory,-A%20comma%20separated|propertiesWithHistory parameter in the Contacts API>?

we’ve been running into issues with any non super admins installing our app. our app isn’t published on the marketplace. possible causes I can think of are our required scopes of our app being scopes that the non super admins don’t have permissions for? I’m not sure how to approach this, ideally the super admin would be able to add the app for all of their users? but I’m not sure how to accomplish this yet.

Hi Salah! Perhaps I misunderstood you and you’ve already tried this, but I would suggest finding the users using their email address first, then using their HubSpot ID’s as the id’s for your objects in your inputs array of the batch? Hopefully that helps and I’m not misunderstanding
Thank you so much!

“amount” should take any line item discounts into account.

If the line items are on a quote though, and the discount was applied at the quote level, opposed to at the line item level — then you may have to do some math. Not sure on that last one though.
